problem.markdown:
You've built a survey and things are going well but you realise you missed out a whole section of questions. These were fortunately only 'nice to have' answers rather than core questions but you still would really like to have a complete dataset. 50 respondents have already replied to your survey.
>>What should be the next step now you know you missed some questions? <<
( ) Delete all the data and start again - it's only 50 respondents. ( ) Contact the 50 people directly by looking them up on the student database directly (x) Decide whether the data is crucial. If yes, amend the survey and note the first 50 respondents will not have data for these questions. Mistakes happen. ( ) Do nothing and deny any knowledge of the mistake if asked.
[explanation] Whilst we are tempted to deny all knowledge, this is really a "triage" situation. If the answers are vital, you'll need to accept a lower N in your respondant pool. Decide what kind of tradeoff you want to make. [explanation]
